availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton J. Graham (Washington Co, Ky, col (U.S.A.))

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, colonel. Harrodsburg, Kentucky, native. Son of Mary Graham. Married to Martha J. Graham. Father of William N. Graham, Wesley Graham, John J. Graham. Farmer in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from August 24, 1861, to February 18, 1862. Served in the 11th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as captain, major, lieutenant colonel, and colonel from August 17, 1862, to July 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 169B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 1, p. 223.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 270, 666.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
KYR-0002-227-0035. KYR-0001-018-0385. KYR-0001-028-0001.
